conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the motion of a particle based on a v-t graph.
The v-t graph is symmetric about a dashed line, indicating a mirror image of motion before and after the dashed line.
The particle's velocity decreases from a positive value to zero and then increases back to the same positive value, forming a symmetric pattern.
The area under the curve from \\( t = 0 \\) to the dashed line is equal to the area from the dashed line to \\( t = t_1 \\).
The particle travels the same distance in both halves of the interval but in opposite directions.
The particle starts with a positive velocity, slows down to zero at the dashed line, and then accelerates back to the initial positive velocity.
The particle crosses a certain position three times: once while moving forward, once while stopping, and once while moving backward.
The position where the particle passes three times is the initial position.
The particle passes through the initial position three times within the time interval from 0 to \\( t_1 \\).
